info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 18 at 8:54PM EDT until August 19 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, City of Newport News, James City and York.
* WHEN...Until midnight EDT tonight.
* IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Local emergency management have reported water rescues.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 854 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Newport News, Williamsburg, Virginia Institute For Marine Sciences, Gloucester Point, Grove, Lee Hall, Busch Gardens, Carver Gardens, York Terrace, U.s. Naval Weapons, Lackey, Water Country U.S.A., Newport News Golf Course and Yorktown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Do not stay in areas subject to flooding when water begins rising.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING

area.areaDesc: James City, VA; York, VA; City of Newport News, VA
